Articles.Content:
Hello! My name is Pluto100, and I need your help. I've been trying to create a good launcher & interplanetary transfer vehicle, but I can never get it to where I need it. So, I'm asking you, the community, to help me out here. I thank you very much for your help!

Transfer Vehicle Requirements:

At least 5000 M/S worth of DV,

Space for a probe,

and able to get to Jool & beyond.

Launcher Requirements:

Able to achieve orbit,

Fast & lightweight,

and able to not explode .

Thank you! I am eternally grateful .

P.S: Sorry if this is in the wrong area.

I would go for something like this:

Craft file: https://skydrive.live.com/redir?resid=384BA28C8578E539!153&authkey=!ANnhdE6B2yV1grA

34 tons on the pad, provides 6000m/s DeltaV in space a minimum of 6m/sÃ‚Â² acceleration for a probe of approximately 1 ton.

The 200L fuel tank above the decoupler is taking the place of the payload, delete it before use. It may wobble a little but it's perfectly flyable, if the wobble bothers you just add a strut or two.

Here's my ol' standby interplanetary rocket:

Transfer stage closeup:

It can get pretty heavy payloads to orbit. The transfer stage has 5623 m/s of Dv innit. I'm considering using the docking port blanks instead of the aero tailpieces for the nuclear engine mounts, as they're lighter, but these look so cool!

Here's my ol' standby interplanetary rocket:

At 400 tons it doesn't really qualify for the lightweight requirement.
Why does your transfer stage have multiple ASAS modules on it?

Why does your transfer stage have multiple ASAS modules on it?

It doesn't, it's a stock 2m ASAS and 2m SAS and probe body parts.

Does it have to be stock? I have a Rocket that might meet those criteria, but it needs the "RLA MMRTG" part/mod.

It carries about 2 tons and has around 7200Dv (assuming max payload weight, with no payload it's closer to 8000Dv), though it doesn't turn all that fast.

Haven't tried going to Jool yet, but I assume it could get there.

Edited May 3, 2013 by Aeshi

I would go for something like this:

-snip-

Craft file: https://skydrive.live.com/redir?resid=384BA28C8578E539!153&authkey=!ANnhdE6B2yV1grA

34 tons on the pad, provides 6000m/s DeltaV in space a minimum of 6m/sÃ‚Â² acceleration for a probe of approximately 1 ton.

The 200L fuel tank above the decoupler is taking the place of the payload, delete it before use. It may wobble a little but it's perfectly flyable, if the wobble bothers you just add a strut or two.

Thanks! I'll probably use this for my missions . Thank you!

Does it have to be stock? I have a Rocket that might meet those criteria, but it needs the "RLA MMRTG" part/mod.

It carries about 2 tons and has around 7200Dv (assuming max payload weight, with no payload it's closer to 8000Dv), though it doesn't turn all that fast.

Haven't tried going to Jool yet, but I assume it could get there.

Sorry I forgot to mention stock/non stock! But yes, any mods are fine. Thank you!

Here's my ol' standby interplanetary rocket:

-snip-

Transfer stage closeup:

-snip-

It can get pretty heavy payloads to orbit. The transfer stage has 5623 m/s of Dv innit. I'm considering using the docking port blanks instead of the aero tailpieces for the nuclear engine mounts, as they're lighter, but these look so cool!

Woah, that's a nice ship ! Hmm... I'll have to think about using that for my Eeloo ones.

Thank you all so much for this help!

Edited May 3, 2013 by Pluto100
snip!

Hello there Pluto, been awhile.

I'll see what I can cook up...
